title: App.tsx: Render login vs signed-in UI directly from auth (remove stored view state)

requirements.summary: Update App.tsx to render LoginScreen when unauthenticated and the existing signed-in app UI when authenticated, removing all stored view/screen state and any splash/readiness/timeout gating.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/App.tsx` no longer uses `useState` (or any other stored state) to track the current screen/view (e.g., no `view`/`setView` pattern for navigation).
The top-level render decision is made directly from `useAuth().auth` during render: falsy auth => `LoginScreen`; truthy auth => existing signed-in routing/UI.
No splash-screen gating remains in `App.tsx` (e.g., no rendering `SplashScreen` and no effects that delay/timeout transition to login).
No gating on readiness flags/timeouts remains in `App.tsx` (e.g., no `isAuthReady` checks; no timer-driven UI transitions that control which screen is shown).
The app compiles successfully with only the change to `frontend/src/App.tsx`.

file_operations.description: Remove the stored `view`/`setView` screen-selection state and any splash/readiness/timeout-driven screen transitions; during render, branch directly on `useAuth().auth` (falsy => render `LoginScreen`, truthy => render the existing signed-in manager/agent UI using the current routing structure unless minor adjustments are required to compile).
